?_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the ice-sheet covered portion of a grid cell, including snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
?_tavg-u-hxy-is.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Ice Sheets

albc_tavg-u-hxy-veg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

albsn_tavg-u-hxy-sn.comment: This is similar to Eday.albsn, but providing monthly averages

areacellg_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: Cell areas any grid used to report ice sheet variables. These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere)
areacellg_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for Ice Sheet Variables

areacellr_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: Cell areas for any grid used to report river model variables (may be the same as for atmospheric variables). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).
areacellr_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for River Model Variables

baresoilFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.

burntFractionAll_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic land use change
burntFractionAll_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Percentage of Entire Grid Cell That Is Covered by Burnt Vegetation (All Classes)

c13Land_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c13Land_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).
c13Land_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Mass of 13C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools

c13Litter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c13Litter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

c13Soil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c13Soil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in soil.

c13Veg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c13Veg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass).

c14Land_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c14Land_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).
c14Land_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Mass of 14C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools

c14Litter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c14Litter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

c14Soil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
c14Soil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in soil.

c14Veg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

c3PftFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees).
c3PftFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Percentage Cover by C3 Plant Functional Type

c4PftFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).
c4PftFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Percentage Cover by C4 Plant Functional Type

cGeologicStorage_tavg-u-hm-u.comment: Mass of carbon that has been intentionally sequestered in geologic storage. The definition of geologic storage here is that it be stored for periods of time that are long as compared to the simulation.

cLand_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cLand_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
cLand_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Carbon in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools

cLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.

cLitterCwd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cLitterCwd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent.
cLitterCwd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris

cLitterSubSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cLitterSubSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: subsurface litter pool fed by root inputs.

cLitterSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cLitterSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Surface or near-surface litter pool fed by leaf and above-ground litterfall

cLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_carbon has the standard name litter_mass_content_of_carbon.

cLitter_tpt-u-hxy-lus.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
cLitter_tpt-u-hxy-lus.comment: end of year values (not annual mean)
cLitter_tpt-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Carbon  in Above and Below-Ground Litter Pools on Land-Use Tiles

cOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stems and Roots

cProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.
cProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Products of Land-Use Change

cProduct_tpt-u-hxy-lus.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
cProduct_tpt-u-hxy-lus.comment: Anthropogenic pools associated with land use tiles into which harvests and cleared carbon are deposited before release into atmosphere PLUS any remaining anthropogenic pools that may be associated with lands which were converted into land use tiles during reported period. Examples of products include paper, cardboard, timber for construction, and crop harvest for food or fuel. Does NOT include residue which is deposited into soil or litter; end of year values (not annual mean).
cProduct_tpt-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Wood and Agricultural Product Pool Carbon Associated with Land-Use Tiles

cRoot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

cSoilAbove1m_tavg-z1m-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cSoilAbove1m_tavg-z1m-hxy-lnd.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
cSoilAbove1m_tavg-z1m-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool Above 1m Depth

cSoilPools_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cSoilPools_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: For models with multiple soil carbon pools, report each pool here. If models also have vertical discretisation these should be aggregated
cSoilPools_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Pool (Summed over Vertical Levels)

cSoil_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cSoil_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.comment: for models with vertically discretised soil carbon, report total soil carbon for each level
cSoil_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Level (Summed over All Soil Carbon Pools in That Level)

cSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon mass in the full depth of the soil model.
cSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass in Model Soil Pool

cSoil_tpt-u-hxy-lus.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
cSoil_tpt-u-hxy-lus.comment: end of year values (not annual mean)
cSoil_tpt-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Carbon in Soil Pool on Land-Use Tiles

cStem_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

cVegGrass_tavg-u-hxy-ng.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.
cVegGrass_tavg-u-hxy-ng.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Grass Tiles

cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.

cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-shb.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.
cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-shb.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Shrub Tiles

cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-tree.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.
cVeg_tavg-u-hxy-tree.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Tree Tiles

cVeg_tpt-u-hxy-lus.cell_methods: area: mean where sector time: point
cVeg_tpt-u-hxy-lus.comment: end of year values (not annual mean)
cVeg_tpt-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Carbon in Vegetation on Land-Use Tiles

cWood_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

cnc_tavg-u-hxy-u.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

cropFracC3_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 crops

cropFracC4_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops

cropFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.

dcw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

depthl_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: Depth of lakes, if this quantity is present in the model. If computed via volume and area, then this is lake volume divided by lake area.
depthl_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Depth of Lake Below the Surface

depthsl_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: Total (cumulative) thickness of all soil layers. This is the sum of individual thicknesses of all soil layers.
depthsl_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Total (Cumulative) Thickness of All Soil Layers

dgw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

drivw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

dslw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

dsn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

dsw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

esn_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

evspsbl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
evspsbl_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

evspsblpot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
evspsblpot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: at surface; potential flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

evspsblsoi_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

evspsblsoi_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Water evaporation flux from soil but for daily averages i.e., the evspsblsoi variable, which is only currently defined for monthly averages
evspsblsoi_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Daily water evaporation flux from soil

evspsblveg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
evspsblveg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: the canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

evspsblveg_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: The same as the current variable evspsblveg but defined on daily timescales.
evspsblveg_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Daily water evaporation flux from canopy

fAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Anthropogenic flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. That is, emissions influenced, caused, or created by human activity. Anthropogenic emission of carbon dioxide includes fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change, except forest regrowth.
fAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation, Litter or Soil Pools into the Atmosphere Due to any Human Activity [kgC m-2 s-1]

fBNF_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fBNF_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.

fCLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fCLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.
fCLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Lateral Transfer of Carbon out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean

fDeforestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fDeforestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
fDeforestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

fDeforestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fDeforestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
fDeforestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change

fFireAll_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fFireAll_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: From all sources,  Including natural, anthropogenic and Land-use change. Only total fire emissions can be compared to observations.
fFireAll_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Including All Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]

fFireNat_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fFireNat_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Natural Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

fFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux) from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
fFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Excluding Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

fHarvestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fHarvestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: any harvested carbon that is assumed to decompose immediately into the atmosphere is reported here
fHarvestToAtmos_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Harvested Biomass That Goes Straight into Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

fHarvestToGeologicStorage_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Flux of carbon harvested from biomass that goes into geologic storage for the purposes of intentional carbon dioxide removal, via efforts such as bioenergy with carbon capture and storage (BECCS) or biomass removal and storage (BiCRS). The definition of geologic storage here is that the resulting carbon be  stored for a period of time that is long relative to that of the simulation.
fHarvestToGeologicStorage_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Geological Storage

fHarvestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fHarvestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: be it food or wood harvest, any carbon that is subsequently stored is reported here
fHarvestToProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool

fLitterFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fLitterFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources
fLitterFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Litter, CWD or any non-Living Pool into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

fLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).
fLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil

fLuc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fLuc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Land Use Change
fLuc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

fLuc_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon directly to the atmosphere due to any land-use or land-cover change activities.  Include carbon transferred due to deforestation or agricultural directly into atmosphere, and  emissions form anthropogenic pools into atmosphere
fLuc_tavg-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Carbon Transferred Directly to Atmosphere Due to any Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Activities [kgC m-2 s-1]

fN2O_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fN2O_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

fNAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: will require some careful definition to make sure we capture everything - any human activity that releases nitrogen from land  instead of into product pool goes here. E.g. Deforestation fire, harvest assumed to decompose straight away, grazing...
fNAnthDisturb_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Nitrogen Mass Flux out of Land Due to any Human Activity

fNLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.
fNLandToOcean_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Lateral Transfer of Nitrogen out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean

fNLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.
fNLitterSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil

fNOx_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNOx_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. "Nox" means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

fNProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
fNProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Deforested or Harvested Biomass as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use or Change

fNVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass.
fNVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter

fNVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
fNVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

fNdep_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNdep_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land

fNfert_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNfert_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area
fNfert_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Nitrogen Added for Cropland Fertilisation (Artificial and Manure)

fNgasFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNgasFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire
fNgasFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from Fire

fNgasNonFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNgasNonFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to all processes other than fire
fNgasNonFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from All Processes Except Fire

fNgas_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNgas_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.
fNgas_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)

fNleach_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNleach_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Leaching" means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, "runoff" refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.
fNleach_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Nitrogen Loss to Leaching or Runoff (Sum of Ammonium, Nitrite and Nitrate)

fNloss_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNloss_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching
fNloss_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)

fNnetmin_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNnetmin_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.
fNnetmin_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Nitrogen Release from Soil and Litter as the Outcome of Nitrogen Immobilisation and Gross Mineralisation

fNup_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fNup_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere.
fNup_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Plant Nitrogen Uptake (Sum of Ammonium and Nitrate) Irrespective of the Source of Nitrogen

fProductDecomp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fProductDecomp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.
fProductDecomp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

fVegFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fVegFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources
fVegFire_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

fVegLitterMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fVegLitterMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
fVegLitterMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality

fVegLitterSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fVegLitterSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
fVegLitterSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence

fVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_mortality and mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation_due_to_senescence is mass_flux_of_carbon_into_litter_from_vegetation.
fVegLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter

fVegSoilMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fVegSoilMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
fVegSoilMortality_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Mortality

fVegSoilSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fVegSoilSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
fVegSoilSenescence_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence

fVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
fVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
fVegSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

fracInLut_tavg-u-hxy-u.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: sum
fracInLut_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as a percentage of atmospheric grid cell
fracInLut_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Annual Gross Percentage That Was Transferred into This Tile from Other Land-Use Tiles

fracLut_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: End of month values (not monthly mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac_lnd = 0.5, frac_ocn = 0.5, frac_crop_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)
fracLut_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile

fracLut_tpt-u-hxy-u.comment: End of year values (not annual mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac_lnd = 0.5, frac_ocn = 0.5, frac_crop_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)
fracLut_tpt-u-hxy-u.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile

fracOutLut_tavg-u-hxy-u.cell_methods: area: mean where land over all_area_types time: sum
fracOutLut_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as percentage of atmospheric grid cell
fracOutLut_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Annual Gross Percentage of Land-Use Tile That Was Transferred into Other Land-Use Tiles

gpp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
gpp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
gpp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

gpp_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.
gpp_tavg-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

gpp_tavg-u-hxy-ng.comment: Total GPP of grass in the grid cell
gpp_tavg-u-hxy-ng.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

gpp_tavg-u-hxy-shb.comment: Total GPP of shrubs in the grid cell
gpp_tavg-u-hxy-shb.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

gpp_tavg-u-hxy-tree.comment: Total GPP of trees in the grid cell
gpp_tavg-u-hxy-tree.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

gppc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
gppc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: The rate of synthesis of carbon-13 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
gppc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

gppc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
gppc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: The rate of synthesis of carbon-14 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.
gppc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

grassFracC3_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 natural grass.

grassFracC4_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 natural grass.

grassFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

hfls_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
hfls_tavg-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Latent Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile

hfss_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: Upward sensible heat flux on land use tiles. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.
hfss_tavg-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Sensible Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile

irrDem_tavg-u-hm-u.comment: the total amount of irrigation water demand

irrGw_tavg-u-hm-u.comment: the amount of water withdrawal for irrigation from ground water, including deep soil water, confined and unconfined aquifer, etc

irr_tavg-u-hm-u.comment: the amount of water withdrawal for irrigation from surface water, including rivers, lakes, reservoirs, etc.)
irr_tavg-u-hm-u.long_name: irrigation water withdrawal from surface water

irr_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: Mass flux of water due to irrigation.
irr_tavg-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Irrigation Flux Including any Irrigation for Crops, Trees, Pasture, or Urban Lawns

lai_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
lai_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

lai_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.
lai_tavg-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Leaf Area Index on Land-Use Tile

landCoverFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their  PFT definitions.   This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.
landCoverFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Percentage of Area by Vegetation or Land-Cover Category

lithk_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: This variable identifies the thickness of a prescribed ice sheet. This information is relevant to better understand how different models treat ice. For models where an ice sheet is just orography + an ice sheet mask, the value should be set to zero. For models that explicitly resolve an ice sheet thickness, the thickness of the ice sheet should be provided.

mrro_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrro_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

mrrob_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

mrros_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrros_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: the total surface runoff leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

mrsfl_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsfl_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in ice phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"
mrsfl_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.long_name: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer

mrsll_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsll_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"
mrsll_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer

mrso_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrso_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

mrsofc_ti-u-hxy-lnd.comment: reported "where land": divide the total water holding capacity of all the soil in the grid cell by the land area in the grid cell;  reported as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.
mrsofc_ti-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Capacity of Soil to Store Water (Field Capacity)

mrsol_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsol_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"
mrsol_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Water Content of Soil Layer

mrsol_tavg-z10cm-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsol_tavg-z10cm-hxy-lnd.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.
mrsol_tavg-z10cm-hxy-lnd.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column

mrsol_tavg-z10cm-hxy-lus.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface layer; integrate over uppermost 10cm
mrsol_tavg-z10cm-hxy-lus.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column of Land-Use Tile

mrsol_tavg-z1m-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsol_tavg-z1m-hxy-lnd.comment: Soil moisture in the top 10 cm of the soil column

mrsol_tpt-z10cm-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: point
mrsol_tpt-z10cm-hxy-lnd.comment: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.
mrsol_tpt-z10cm-hxy-lnd.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column

mrsow_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

mrtws_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrtws_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: requested for C4MIP, OCMIP/OMIP, LUMIP, ScenarioMIP, DECK, DAMIP, GeoMIP, LS3MIP, ??

nLand_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nLand_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
nLand_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Nitrogen in All Terrestrial Nitrogen Pools

nLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.

nLitterCwd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nLitterCwd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.
nLitterCwd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Coarse Woody Debris

nLitterSubSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nLitterSubSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Subsurface litter" means the part of the litter mixed within the soil below the surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.
nLitterSubSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Below-Ground Litter (non CWD)

nLitterSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nLitterSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.
nLitterSurf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Above-Ground Litter (non CWD)

nLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

nMineralNH4_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nMineralNH4_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: SUM of ammonium over all soil layers

nMineralNO3_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nMineralNO3_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: SUM of nitrate over all soil layers

nMineral_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nMineral_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: SUM of ammonium, nitrite, nitrate, etc over all soil layers

nOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stem and Root

nProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.
nProduct_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Products of Land-Use Change

nRoot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

nSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

nStem_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

nVeg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nVeg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

nbp or necb_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: Computed as npp minus heterotrophic respiration minus fire minus C leaching minus harvesting/clearing. Positive rate is into the land, negative rate is from the land.  Do not include fluxes from anthropogenic product pools to atmosphere
nbp or necb_tavg-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Land-Use Tile [kgC m-2 s-1]

nbp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nbp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes  from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux  is into the land.
nbp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Biospheric Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

nep_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nep_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

netAtmosLandC13Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
netAtmosLandC13Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Flux of carbon 31as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).-
netAtmosLandC13Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Mass Flux of 13C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

netAtmosLandC14Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
netAtmosLandC14Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).
netAtmosLandC14Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

netAtmosLandCO2Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
netAtmosLandCO2Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).
netAtmosLandCO2Flux_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

nppGrass_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Total NPP of grass in the grid cell
nppGrass_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

nppLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nppLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP
nppLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

nppOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nppOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

nppRoot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nppRoot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP
nppRoot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

nppShrub_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Total NPP of shrubs in the grid cell
nppShrub_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

nppStem_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nppStem_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

nppTree_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Total NPP of trees in the grid cell
nppTree_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

nppVgt_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
nppVgt_tavg-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Net Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

npp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
npp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
npp_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Net Primary Production on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

orog_tavg-u-hxy-is.comment: This is needed in case the ice sheet elevation changes in time

orog_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: height above the geoid; as defined here, "the geoid" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).

pastureFracC3_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 pasture

pastureFracC4_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 pasture

pastureFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.
pastureFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Percentage of Land Which Is Anthropogenic Pasture

prveg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prveg_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: the precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.

qgwr_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

raGrass_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Total RA of grass in the grid cell
raGrass_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

raLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
raLeaf_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Respiration from Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

raLut_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on land-use tiles.
raLut_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

raOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
raOther_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Respiration from Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

raRoot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
raRoot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Total autotrophic respiration from all belowground plant parts.  This has benchmarking value because the sum of Rh and root respiration can be compared to observations of total soil respiration.
raRoot_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Respiration from Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

raShrub_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Total RA of shrubs in the grid cell
raShrub_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

raStem_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
raStem_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Respiration from Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

raTree_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Total RA of trees in the grid cell
raTree_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

raVgt_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on vegetation type.
raVgt_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

ra_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
ra_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]
ra_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

rac13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rac13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Flux of carbon-13 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.
rac13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

rac14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rac14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Flux of carbon-14 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.
rac14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

residualFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by "non-vegetation" and "non-bare-soil" (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)
residualFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil

rhGrass_tavg-u-hxy-ng.comment: Total RH of grass in the grid cell
rhGrass_tavg-u-hxy-ng.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

rhLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rhLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Needed to calculate litter bulk turnover time. Includes respiration from CWD as well.
rhLitter_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Litter on Land

rhLut_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers), calculated on land-use tiles.
rhLut_tavg-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

rhShrub_tavg-u-hxy-shb.comment: Total RH of shrubs in the grid cell
rhShrub_tavg-u-hxy-shb.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

rhSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rhSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Needed to calculate soil bulk turnover time
rhSoil_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Soil on Land

rhTree_tavg-u-hxy-tree.comment: Total RH of trees in the grid cell
rhTree_tavg-u-hxy-tree.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

rhVgt_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers), calculated on vegetation type.
rhVgt_tavg-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

rh_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rh_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)
rh_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Total Heterotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

rhc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rhc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.
rhc13_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

rhc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rhc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.
rhc14_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

rivi_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

rivo_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

rootd_ti-u-hxy-lnd.comment: report the maximum soil depth reachable by plant roots (if defined in model), i.e., the maximum soil depth from which they can extract moisture; report as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-sn.comment: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell covered by snow but not by ice. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-sn.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Snow

rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.cell_methods: area: time: mean where unfrozen_soil (at the surface, but frozen below zero isotherm)
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.comment: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell not covered by ice sheets or snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsds_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Land Not Covered by Ice Sheets or Snow

rsus_tavg-u-hxy-sn.comment: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell covered by snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-sn.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Snow

rsus_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.cell_methods: area: time: mean where unfrozen_soil (at the surface, but frozen below zero isotherm)
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.comment: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell not covered by ice sheets or snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.
rsus_tavg-u-hxy-ufs.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Land Not Covered by Ice Sheets or Snow

rzwc_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

sftgif_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by land ice (ice sheet, ice shelf, ice cap, glacier)

sftgif_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: fraction of grid cell occupied by "permanent" ice (i.e., glaciers).

sftlkf_ti-u-hxy-u.comment: Fraction of horizontal land grid cell area occupied by lake.
sftlkf_ti-u-hxy-u.long_name: Fraction of the Grid Cell Occupied by Lake

shrubFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

sw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
sw_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Total liquid water storage, other than soil, snow or interception storage (i.e. lakes, river channel or depression storage).

sweLut_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "lwe" means liquid water equivalent. "Amount" means mass per unit area. The construction lwe_thickness_of_X_amount or _content means the vertical extent of a layer of liquid water having the same mass per unit area. Surface amount refers to the amount on the ground, excluding that on the plant or vegetation canopy.
sweLut_tavg-u-hxy-lus.long_name: Snow Water Equivalent on Land-Use Tile

tas_tavg-h2m-hxy-lus.comment: Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature.
tas_tavg-h2m-hxy-lus.long_name: Near-Surface Air Temperature on Land Use Tile

tas_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Hourly Temperature at 2m above the surface

tran_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tran_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).

treeFracBdlDcd_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf deciduous trees.

treeFracBdlEvg_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf evergreen trees.

treeFracNdlDcd_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf deciduous trees.

treeFracNdlEvg_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf evergreen trees.

treeFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

ts_tavg-u-hxy-lus.comment: Surface temperature (i.e. temperature at which long-wave radiation emitted)

tsl_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tsl_tavg-l-hxy-lnd.comment: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".

tslsi_tavg-u-hxy-u.cell_methods: area: time: mean (over land and sea ice)
tslsi_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean.
tslsi_tavg-u-hxy-u.long_name: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice

tslsi_tpt-u-hxy-u.cell_methods: area: mean (over land and sea ice) time: point
tslsi_tpt-u-hxy-u.comment: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean, sampled synoptically.
tslsi_tpt-u-hxy-u.long_name: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice

vegFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of grid cell that is covered by vegetation.This SHOULD be the sum of tree, grass (natural and pasture), crop and shrub fractions.

vegHeight_tavg-u-hxy-shb.comment: Vegetation height averaged over the shrub fraction of a grid cell.

vegHeight_tavg-u-hxy-tree.comment: Vegetation height averaged over the tree fraction of a grid cell.

vegHeight_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Vegetation height averaged over the grass fraction of a grid cell.

vegHeight_tavg-u-hxy-veg.comment: Vegetation height averaged over all vegetation types and over the vegetated fraction of a grid cell.

wetlandCH4_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
wetlandCH4_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Net upward flux of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).
wetlandCH4_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Emissions from Wetlands

wetlandCH4cons_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
wetlandCH4cons_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Biological consumption (methanotrophy) of methane (NH4) by wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).
wetlandCH4cons_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Consumption (Methanotrophy) from Wetlands

wetlandCH4prod_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
wetlandCH4prod_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.comment: Biological emissions (methanogenesis) of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).
wetlandCH4prod_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Production (Methanogenesis) from Wetlands

wetlandFrac_tavg-u-hxy-u.comment: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

wtd_tavg-u-hxy-lnd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
